functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Who are the current leaders of the 5 countries that currently have the highest GDP in the world?

Recent economic data suggest the economy is accelerating despite higher borrowing costs, the resumption of student-loan payments, and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East ... Analysts, many of whom had expected a recession this year, are pushing up their forecasts ... After predicting a recession for the past year, economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal this month said they now believe that the economy will avoid a downturn in the next 12 months.

Biden entered office nine months into a recovery from the COVID-19 recession and his first year in office was characterized by robust growth in real GDP, employment, wages and stock market returns, amid significantly elevated inflation. Real GDP grew 5.9 percent, the fastest rate in 37 years.[341][342] Amid record job creation, the unemployment rate fell at the fastest pace on record during the year.[343][344][345] By the end of 2021, inflation reached a nearly 40-year high of 7.1 percent, which was partially offset by the highest nominal wage and salary growth in at least 20 years.[346][347][348][349] In his third month in office, Biden signed an executive order to increase the minimum wage for federal contractors to $15 per hour, an increase of nearly 37 percent. The order went into effect for 390,000 workers in January 2022.[350][351]

Biden entered office nine months into a recovery from the COVID-19 recession and his first year in office was characterized by robust growth in real GDP, employment, wages and stock market returns, amid significantly elevated inflation. Real GDP grew 5.9 percent, the fastest rate in 37 years.[341][342] Amid record job creation, the unemployment rate fell at the fastest pace on record during the year.[343][344][345] By the end of 2021, inflation reached a nearly 40-year high of 7.1 percent, which was partially offset by the highest nominal wage and salary growth in at least 20 years.[346][347][348][349] In his third month in office, Biden signed an executive order to increase the minimum wage for federal contractors to $15 per hour, an increase of nearly 37 percent. The order went into effect for 390,000 workers in January 2022.[350][351]

China's economy has grown under Xi, with GDP in nominal terms more than doubling from $8.53 trillion in 2012 to $17.73 trillion in 2021,[171] while China's nominal GDP per capita surpassed the world average in 2021,[172] though the rate of growth has slowed from 7.9% in 2012 to 6% in 2019.[173] Xi has stressed the importance of "high-quality growth" rather than "inflated growth".[174] He has additionally stated that China will focus on quality of economic growth and that it has abandoned a growth-at-all-costs strategy which Xi refers to as "GDP heroism".[175]: 22 Instead, Xi said that other social issues such as environmental protection are important.[175]: 22 His administration pursued a debt-deleveraging campaign, seeking to slow and cut the unsustainable amount of debt China has accrued during its economic growth.[176] Though China's total non-financial-sector debt-to-GDP ratio reached a record 270.9% by 2020 during the COVID-19 crisis,

China's economy has grown under Xi, with GDP in nominal terms more than doubling from $8.53 trillion in 2012 to $17.73 trillion in 2021,[171] while China's nominal GDP per capita surpassed the world average in 2021,[172] though the rate of growth has slowed from 7.9% in 2012 to 6% in 2019.[173] Xi has stressed the importance of "high-quality growth" rather than "inflated growth".[174] He has additionally stated that China will focus on quality of economic growth and that it has abandoned a growth-at-all-costs strategy which Xi refers to as "GDP heroism".[175]: 22 Instead, Xi said that other social issues such as environmental protection are important.[175]: 22 His administration pursued a debt-deleveraging campaign, seeking to slow and cut the unsustainable amount of debt China has accrued during its economic growth.[176] Though China's total non-financial-sector debt-to-GDP ratio reached a record 270.9% by 2020 during the COVID-19 crisis,

msg.content:
Based on the search results, here are the key points about Xi Jinping:

1. Current Position:
- Xi Jinping is the current leader of China, serving as General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party and the state representative
- He is considered one of the most powerful leaders in China's recent history

2. Economic Leadership:
- Under Xi's leadership, China's economy has grown significantly:
  - GDP doubled from $8.53 trillion in 2012 to $17.73 trillion in 2021
  - China's nominal GDP per capita surpassed the world average in 2021
- He has shifted focus from "GDP heroism" to emphasizing "high-quality growth"
- His administration has pursued debt-deleveraging campaigns and environmental protection

3. International Standing:
- Xi is considered one of the most influential world leaders
- In 2017, The Economist named him the most powerful person in the world
- In 2018, Forbes ranked him as the most powerful and influential person globally
- He represents China in major international forums including:
  - G20
  - BRICS
  - Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC)

4. Public Opinion:
- International polling shows mixed views:
  - A 2021 Politico/Morning Consult poll found that among Americans:
    - 5% had a favorable opinion
    - 38% had an unfavorable opinion
    - 17% had no opinion
    - 40% had never heard of him

5. Significant Policies:
- Emphasized environmental protection alongside economic growth
- Focused on poverty alleviation
